All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AleaCommand
AleaCommand class represents a command that allows the player to set a random room (alea room) when the game is in test mode.
BackCommand
Represents the command to move the player back to the previous room in their itinerary.
Beamer
Beamer class represents an item that is associated with a room.
Characterr
Represents a character in the game.
ChargeCommand
ChargeCommand class represents a command that allows the player to charge their beamer.
Command
Command class is an abstract class that serves as a base for specific game commands.
CommandWord
Representations for all the valid command words for the game along with a description string and corresponding commands.
CommandWords
The CommandWords class holds all the valid command words that the game recognizes.
Door
The Door class represents a door in the game.
DropCommand
Command that allows the player to drop an item in the current room.
EatCommand
Command allowing the player to consume a specific item, adjusting their weight depending on the item consumed.
FireCommand
FireCommand class is a command that allows the player to fire the beamer.
FixCommand
FixCommand class is a command that allows the player to fix a bug if he finds his PC.
Game
Game class
GameEngine
This class represents the core engine of the game, responsible for managing game elements such as rooms, items, and characters.
GoCommand
GoCommand class represents a command that allows the player to move to a different room by specifying a direction (North, South, East, West, etc.).
HelpCommand
The HelpCommand class represents the command that the player can issue to get help or guidance.
InteractCommand
Represents the command to interact with a character in the game.
Item
Represents an item with a name, description, and weight.
ItemList
Manages a collection of items.
ItemsCommand
ItemsCommand a class that prints the player's items.
LookCommand
The LookCommand class is used to handle the "look" command in the game.
MovingCharacter
MovingCharacter class represents a character that can move between rooms.
Parser
This class parses user input, maps it to known commands, and returns the corresponding Command object.
Player
Represents a player in the game.
QuitCommand
Command that handles quitting the game.
Room
This class represents a room in the game with exits, items, characters, and doors / trapdoors.
RoomRandomizer
Randomizes room selection for the game.
TakeCommand
Command that allows the player to pick up an item from the current room if they can carry it.
TestCommand
The TestCommand class is used to execute a series of commands from a file.
TransporterRoom
This class represents a special type of room in the game, known as a transporter room.
TrapDoor
Represents a trap door in the game that extends a Door.
UnknownCommand
Command that handles unrecognized player inputs.
UserInterface
This class implements a simple graphical user interface with a text entry area, a text output area and an optional image.
